<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Volumes were higher in the Americas and EMEA,
	primarily due to increased Personal Care volumes, partly offset by adverse pricing pressures affecting the price and product mix. ASPAC saw lower volumes offset by a favorable price and product mix. A weakening of the European Union euro and the
	British pound sterling against the U.S. dollar resulted in an
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	36
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage38"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D303010D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	adverse exchange variance for EMEA and ASPAC. The disposal of our Aroma Chemicals business has been excluded from the market analysis above and included as one variance for the segment total.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<I>
	Gross margin:
</I>
	the year on year increase of 2.8 percentage
	points was primarily driven by a greater proportion of sales from our higher margin Personal Care business, following the disposal of our Aroma Chemicals business at the start of the third quarter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<I>
	Operating expenses:
</I>
	the year on year increase of $0.2&nbsp;million was
	primarily due to $0.8&nbsp;million higher research and development costs and $0.4&nbsp;million of additional headcount to support our Personal Care growth, partly offset by a $1.1&nbsp;million reduction due to the disposal of our Aroma Chemicals
	business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Oilfield Services
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<I>
	Net sales:
</I>
	the year on year increase of $103.7&nbsp;million was
	primarily due to the full year benefit of the acquisition of Independence.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<I>
	Gross margin:
</I>
	the year on year increase of 0.8 percentage points is primarily driven by a favorable product mix.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<I>
	Operating expenses: the year on
</I>
	year increase of $49.2&nbsp;million
	was due to the full year effect of the acquisition of our Independence business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Octane Additives
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<I>
	Net sales:
</I>
	the year on year increase of $4.3&nbsp;million was primarily due to the timing of demand with our one remaining refinery customer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<I>
	Gross margin:
</I>
	the year on year decrease of 3.9 percentage points is
	primarily driven by the timing and efficiency of production for our one remaining refinery customer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<I>
	Operating expenses:
</I>
	the year on year decrease of $2.2&nbsp;million was due to the continuing efficient management of the cost base.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Other Income Statement Captions
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<I>
	Pension credit/(charge):
</I>
	is
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash,
</FONT>
	and was a $0.2&nbsp;million net credit in 2015 compared to
	$3.3&nbsp;million net charge in 2014, primarily driven by lower interest cost on the projected benefit obligation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<I>
	Corporate costs:
</I>
	the year on year decrease of $0.4&nbsp;million, related to $1.1&nbsp;million lower legal, professional and other expenses in 2015 driven by the recovery of legal fees;
	$1.8&nbsp;million
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-recurring
</FONT>
	professional costs in 2014 related to the acquisition of our Independence business; $1.4&nbsp;million lower insurance claims due to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-recurring
</FONT>
	charges in 2014 relating to self-insured incidents; which were partly offset by $3.1&nbsp;million higher personnel-related compensation, including higher accruals for share-based compensation;
	and the net $0.8&nbsp;million release of a severance provision in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	37
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage39"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D303010D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<I>
	Adjustment to fair value of contingent consideration:
</I>
	the credit of $40.7&nbsp;million relates to an
	adjustment of the carrying value of our liability for contingent consideration related to our Independence acquisition of $51.4&nbsp;million, partly offset by the accretion charge of $10.7&nbsp;million. The carrying value of the contingent
	consideration is based on the estimated EBITDA and free cash flow generated by the Independence business through the period to October&nbsp;31, 2016. The contingent consideration payable is based on management&#146;s latest forecasts of the business
	and on the current trading performance. The results of the business are particularly sensitive to the level of exploration, development and production activity of our customers in the oil and gas sector, this is directly affected by trends in oil
	prices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<I>
	Profit on disposal of subsidiary:
</I>
	The disposal of
	our Aroma Chemicals business generated a profit on disposal of $1.6&nbsp;million in the third quarter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<I>
	Other net income/(expense):
</I>
	other net expense of $0.0&nbsp;million primarily related to $1.4&nbsp;million of losses on translation of net assets denominated in
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-functional
</FONT>
	currencies in our European businesses, offset by gains of $1.4&nbsp;million on foreign currency forward exchange contracts. In 2014, other net income of $1.8&nbsp;million primarily related to
	net gains of $3.4&nbsp;million on foreign currency forward exchange contracts, partly offset by $1.6&nbsp;million of losses on translation of net assets denominated in
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-functional
</FONT>
	currencies in our European
	businesses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<I>
	Interest expense, net:
</I>
	was $4.0&nbsp;million
	in 2015 and $3.4&nbsp;million in 2014, being primarily driven by higher borrowing in 2015 resulting from the funding required for the acquisition of our Independence business in the fourth quarter of 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<I>
	Income taxes:
</I>
	the effective tax rate was 21.5% and 24.2% in 2015 and
	2014, respectively. The effective tax rate, as adjusted for changes to the fair value of contingent consideration, adjustments to income tax positions and the tax impact of other discrete items, was 20.1% in 2015 compared with 24.9% in 2014. The
	Company believes that this adjusted effective tax rate, a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-GAAP
</FONT>
	financial measure, provides useful information to investors and may assist them in evaluating the Company&#146;s underlying performance and
	identifying operating trends. In addition, management uses this
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-GAAP
</FONT>
	financial measure internally to evaluate the performance of the Company&#146;s operations and for planning and forecasting in subsequent
	periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	38
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The impact on the effective tax rate from
	profits earned in foreign jurisdictions with lower tax rates varies as the geographical mix of the Company&#146;s profits changes year on year. In 2015, the Company&#146;s income tax expense benefited to a lesser degree from a proportion of its
	overall profits arising in Switzerland than in 2014. This resulted in a $7.5&nbsp;million benefit in Switzerland (2014 &#150; $9.4 million). In addition, there was a $6.8&nbsp;million benefit in relation to the United Kingdom (2014 &#150; $7.9
	million) and a $0.3&nbsp;million benefit in relation to Germany (2014 &#150; $0.4 million), offset by a $0.1&nbsp;million reduction in other jurisdictions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Foreign income inclusions arise each year from certain types of income earned overseas being taxable under U.S. tax regulations. These types of income
	include Subpart F income, principally from foreign based company sales in the United Kingdom, including the associated Section&nbsp;78 tax gross up, and also from the income earned by certain overseas subsidiaries taxable under the U.S. tax regime.
	In 2015, Subpart F income and the associated Section&nbsp;78 gross up resulted in U.S. taxation of $4.7&nbsp;million (2014 &#150; $5.0 million). Certain overseas subsidiaries taxable under the U.S. tax regime incurred losses of $0.2&nbsp;million
	(2014 &#150; $2.1&nbsp;million income).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Foreign tax credits can
	fully or partially offset these incremental U.S. taxes from foreign income inclusions. The utilization of foreign tax credits varies year on year as this is dependent on a number of variable factors which are difficult to predict and may in certain
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	39
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D303010D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	years prevent any offset of foreign tax credits. In total, $4.7&nbsp;million of foreign tax credits were utilized during 2015 to offset the incremental U.S. taxes arising from foreign income
	inclusions in the year (2014 &#150; $4.8 million). Of this balance, $2.4&nbsp;million of foreign tax credit carry forwards from earlier years was utilized (2014 &#150; $3.6 million). As at December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company has utilized all foreign
	tax credit carry forwards from earlier years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The United
	Kingdom&#146;s 1% reduction in the corporation tax rate from 20% to 19% from April 2017 and subsequent reduction from 19% to 18% in April 2020, enacted in November 2015, resulted in a deferred tax credit of $1.1&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of
	2015 in relation to the deferred tax position of the United Kingdom defined benefit pension plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Further details are given in Note 10 of the Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	LIQUIDITY AND FINANCIAL CONDITION
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Working Capital
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The Company believes that adjusted working capital, a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-GAAP
</FONT>
	financial measure, provides useful information to
	investors in evaluating the Company&#146;s underlying performance and identifying operating trends. Management uses this
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-GAAP
</FONT>
	financial measure internally to allocate resources and evaluate the performance
	of the Company&#146;s operations. Items excluded from the adjusted working capital calculation are listed in the table below and represent factors which do not fluctuate in line with the day to day working capital needs of the business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Adjusted working capital
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	$
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	180.5
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	167.1
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:3PX DOUBLE #000000">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	In 2016 our working capital increased by
	$5.4&nbsp;million driven by the acquisition of Huntsman together with various movements year on year, some of which are included in the
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	40
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage42"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D303010D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	reconciliation above to adjust our working capital to better represent the operational activity of the Company. Adjusted working capital shown above has increased by $13.4&nbsp;million, with
	$12.2&nbsp;million being related to the acquisition of Huntsman. Excluding the acquisition our adjusted working capital increased by $1.2&nbsp;million, being primarily driven by higher receivables as the Company ended the year with high demand from
	customers, partly offset by lower inventories year on year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Excluding the Huntsman acquisition, we had a $6.0&nbsp;million increase in trade and other accounts receivable in 2016 primarily in our Oilfield Services
	segment. Days&#146; sales outstanding in our Fuel Specialties segment decreased from 47 days to 45 days; increased from 43 days to 55 days in our Performance Chemicals segment; and increased from 44 days to 54 in our Oilfield Services segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Excluding the Huntsman acquisition, we had a $7.3&nbsp;million
	decrease in inventories in 2016, which is primarily related to lower inventory in our Fuel Specialties business partly offset by increased inventory from the higher production volumes in our Octane Additives segment. Days&#146; sales in inventory in
	our Fuel Specialties segment decreased from 96 days to 84 days; increased in our Performance Chemicals segment from 83 days to 94 days; and decreased from 82 to 72 days in our Oilfield Services segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Excluding the Huntsman acquisition, prepaid expenses decreased by
	$0.4&nbsp;million in 2016 from $6.1&nbsp;million to $5.7&nbsp;million due to the timing of invoicing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Excluding the Huntsman acquisition, we had a $2.9&nbsp;million decrease in accounts payable and accrued liabilities in 2016. Creditor days in our Fuel Specialties segment increased from 26 days to 28
	days; in our Performance Chemicals segment increased from 31 days to 32 days; and remained unchanged year on year at 32 days in our Oilfield Services segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Operating Cash Flows
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	We generated cash from operating activities of $104.5&nbsp;million in 2016 compared to $117.7&nbsp;million in 2015. Year over year cash from operating
	activities has been adversely impacted by lower operating income, partly offset by lower cash outflows for our working capital requirements and lower cash contributions to our defined benefit pension plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Cash
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, we had cash and cash equivalents of $101.9&nbsp;million and $136.9&nbsp;million,
	respectively, of which $90.2&nbsp;million and $118.8&nbsp;million, respectively, were held by
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-U.S.
</FONT>
	subsidiaries principally in the United Kingdom. The Company is in a position to control whether or not to
	repatriate foreign earnings. We currently do not expect to make a repatriation in the foreseeable future and hence have not provided for future income taxes on the cash held by overseas subsidiaries. The amount of unremitted earnings at
	December&nbsp;31, 2016 was approximately $788&nbsp;million. If circumstances were to change that would cause these earnings to be repatriated, an additional U.S. tax liability could be incurred, and we continue to monitor this position.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	41
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage43"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D303010D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Short-term Investments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, we had short-term investments of
	$0.0&nbsp;million and $4.8&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Debt
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	On December&nbsp;14, 2016, Innospec and certain subsidiaries
	of the Company entered into a Third Amendment and Restatement Agreement with various lenders which amends and restates the Company&#146;s credit facility agreement dated December&nbsp;14, 2011, as amended and restated on August&nbsp;28, 2013 and
	November&nbsp;6, 2015 (the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	&#147;Pre-Existing
</FONT>
	Credit Agreement;&#148; the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Existing
</FONT>
	Credit Agreement, as amended and restated pursuant to the Third Amendment and
	Restatement Agreement, being the &#147;Amended Credit Agreement.&#148;)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The Amended Credit Agreement retains the $200,000,000 revolving credit facility available to the Company and adds a term loan facility of $110,000,000. The termination date of the revolving facility
	remains November&nbsp;6, 2020. The term loan has an $11,000,000 repayment installment due December&nbsp;28, 2017, a $16,500,000 installment due December&nbsp;28, 2018 and a $22,000,000 installment due December&nbsp;28, 2019, with the outstanding
	balance due on November&nbsp;6, 2020.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The term loan and credit
	facility contains terms which, if breached, would result in it becoming repayable on demand. It requires, among other matters, compliance with the following financial covenant ratios measured on a quarterly basis: (1)&nbsp;our ratio of net debt to
	EBITDA must not be greater than 3.0:1 and (2)&nbsp;our ratio of EBITDA to net interest must not be less than 4.0:1. Management has determined that the Company has not breached these covenants throughout the period to December&nbsp;31, 2016 and does
	not expect to breach these covenants for the next 12 months. The credit facility is secured by a number of fixed and floating charges over certain assets which include key operating sites of the Company and its subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The current credit facility contains restrictions which may limit our
	activities, and operational and financial flexibility. We may not be able to borrow if an event of default is outstanding, which includes a material adverse change to our assets, operations or financial condition. The credit facility contains a
	number of restrictions that limit our ability, among other things, and subject to certain limited exceptions, to incur additional indebtedness, pledge our assets as security, guarantee obligations of third parties, make investments, effect a merger
	or consolidation, dispose of assets, or materially change our line of business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2016, we had $161.0&nbsp;million of debt outstanding under the revolving credit facility, $110.0&nbsp;million of debt outstanding on our new term loan and $4.5&nbsp;million of
	obligations under finance leases relating to certain fixed assets within our Oilfield Services segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	42
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	$
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	261.4
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PX">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:3PX DOUBLE #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:3PX DOUBLE #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The fair value of long-term debt approximates
	to the carrying value, as the discounting to its present value is offset by the payments under the interest rate swaps.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Outlook
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Our positive results for 2016 are a result of a strong business performance aligned to a proven strategy. Delivering new products to customers in our key markets, combined with good customer service has
	enabled us to meet our expectations, in spite of some very challenging market conditions. The business has continued to generate good cash flows, and, including the significant acquisition from Huntsman, our leverage is still at a relatively low
	level.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	We continue to have expectations that our Fuel Specialties
	and Performance Chemicals businesses will deliver good performances in 2017. We believe that prospects for our Oilfield Services business look to be better than 2016, although this will depend on continued stability or improvement in crude oil
	prices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	We expect to continue to focus on the development of new
	technology, combined with good customer service, in order to maintain our competitive advantage.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	We anticipate a decline in revenues from our Octane Additives segment. We have not reached agreement on a new contract with our sole remaining refinery customer and thus have limited visibility for 2017
	and beyond, although we have received an inquiry from them regarding additional supply of TEL in 2017 and possibly into 2018.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2016, the Company had cash and cash equivalents of $101.9&nbsp;million, long-term debt of $268.8&nbsp;million and finance leases of
	$4.5&nbsp;million, giving total debt of $273.3&nbsp;million, resulting in a net debt position of $171.4&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	During 2016 the Company repurchased 161,029 of our common stock at a cost of $7.5&nbsp;million, under the authorized share repurchase program announced on
	November&nbsp;3, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The Company expects to fund its operations
	and share repurchase program over at least the next 12 months from a combination of operating cash flows and its revolving credit facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	43
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage45"></A>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<U>
	Operating activities
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The amounts related to pension obligations refer to the likely levels of
	funding of our United&nbsp;Kingdom defined benefit pension plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;). The Plan is closed to future service accrual, but has a large number of deferred and current pensioners. The Company expects its annual cash contribution to be
	$1.0&nbsp;million in 2017, $1.9&nbsp;million in
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2018-19
</FONT>
	and $1.9&nbsp;million in
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2020-21.
</FONT>
	It is not considered meaningful to predict amounts beyond 2021 since there are
	too many uncertainties including future returns on assets, pension increases and inflation which are evaluated when the plan undertakes an actuarial valuation every three years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Remediation payments represent those cash flows that the Company is currently
	obligated to pay in respect of environmental remediation of current and former facilities. It does not include any discretionary remediation costs that the Company may choose to incur.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Operating lease commitments relate primarily to office space, motor vehicles and various items of computer and office equipment
	which are expected to be renewed and replaced in the normal course of business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Raw material purchase obligations relate to certain long-term raw material contracts which stipulate fixed or minimum quantities to be purchased; fixed, minimum or variable cost provisions; and the
	approximate timing of the transaction. Purchase obligations exclude agreements that are cancelable without penalty.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The estimated payments included in the table above reflect the variable interest charge on long-term debt obligations. Estimated commitment fees are also included and interest income is excluded.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	44
</FONT>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Due to the uncertainty regarding the nature of tax audits, particularly those which are not currently
	underway, it is not meaningful to predict the outcome of obligations related to unrecognized tax benefits. Further disclosure is provided in Note&nbsp;10 of the Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<U>
	Investing activities
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Capital commitments relate to certain capital projects that the Company has
	committed to undertake.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<U>
	Financing activities
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	On December&nbsp;14, 2016, Innospec and certain subsidiaries of the Company
	entered into a Third Amendment and Restatement Agreement with various lenders which amends and restates the Company&#146;s credit facility agreement dated December&nbsp;14, 2011, as amended and restated on August&nbsp;28, 2013 and November&nbsp;6,
	2015 (the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	&#147;Pre-Existing
</FONT>
	Credit Agreement;&#148; the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Existing
</FONT>
	Credit Agreement, as amended and restated pursuant to the Third Amendment and Restatement
	Agreement, being the &#147;Amended Credit Agreement.&#148;)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The
	Amended Credit Agreement retains the $200,000,000 revolving credit facility available to the Company and adds a term loan facility of $110,000,000. The termination date of the revolving facility remains November&nbsp;6, 2020. The term loan has an
	$11,000,000 repayment installment due December&nbsp;28, 2017, a $16,500,000 installment due December&nbsp;28, 2018 and a $22,000,000 installment due December&nbsp;28, 2019, with the outstanding balance due on November&nbsp;6, 2020.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Finance leases relate to the financing of certain fixed assets in our
	Oilfield Services segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	As part of the acquisition of
	Independence, Innospec has deferred consideration which is contingently payable over the two years post acquisition based on a multiple of Independence&#146;s annualized earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization plus a
	percentage of free cash flow. Innospec paid $44.0&nbsp;million as part of the deferred consideration on January&nbsp;11, 2016 in line with the terms of the sale and purchase agreement. Innospec has provided for a further deferred consideration
	payment of $1.1&nbsp;million to be paid in early 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Environmental Matters and Plant Closures
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Under certain environmental laws the Company is responsible for the remediation of hazardous substances or wastes at currently or formerly owned or
	operated properties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	As most of our manufacturing operations have
	been conducted outside the U.S., we expect that liability pertaining to the investigation and remediation of contaminated properties is likely to be determined under
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-U.S.
</FONT>
	law.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	We evaluate costs for remediation, decontamination and demolition projects on
	a regular basis. Full provision is made for those costs to which we are committed under environmental laws amounting to $39.5
<B>
</B>
	&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2016. Remediation expenditure utilizing these provisions was $2.7&nbsp;million,
	$2.6&nbsp;million and $2.0&nbsp;million in the years 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	45
</FONT>
</P>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D303010D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
</EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
</EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET_RISK"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="4">
<B>
<A NAME="D303010D10K_HTM_TX303010_12">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;7A
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="4">
<B>
	Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The Company uses floating rate debt to finance its global operations. The Company is subject to business risks inherent in
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-U.S.
</FONT>
	activities, including political and economic uncertainty, import and export limitations, and market risk related to changes in interest rates and foreign currency exchange rates. The political and
	economic risks are mitigated by the stability of the countries in which the Company&#146;s largest operations are located. Credit limits, ongoing credit evaluation and account monitoring procedures are used to minimize bad debt risk. Collateral is
	not generally required.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	From time to time, the Company uses
	derivatives, including interest rate swaps, commodity swaps and foreign currency forward exchange contracts, in the normal course of business to manage market risks. The derivatives used in hedging activities are considered risk management tools and
	are not used for trading purposes. In addition, the Company enters into derivative instruments with a diversified group of major financial institutions in order to manage the exposure to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-performance
</FONT>
	of
	such instruments. The Company&#146;s objective in managing the exposure to changes in interest rates is to limit the impact of such changes on earnings and cash flows and to lower overall borrowing costs. The Company&#146;s objective in managing the
	exposure to changes in foreign currency exchange rates is to reduce volatility on earnings and cash flows associated with such changes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The Company offers fixed prices for some long-term sales contracts. As manufacturing and raw material costs are subject to variability the Company may use
	commodity swaps to hedge the cost of some raw materials thus reducing volatility on earnings and cash flows. The derivatives are considered risk management tools and are not used for trading purposes. The Company&#146;s objective is to manage its
	exposure to fluctuating costs of raw materials.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Interest Rate
	Risk
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	From time to time, the Company uses interest rate swaps
	to manage interest rate exposure. As at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2016&nbsp;the Company had cash, cash equivalents and short-term investments of $101.9&nbsp;million, no bank overdraft and long-term debt and finance leases of $273.3&nbsp;million
	(including current portion). Long-term debt comprises a $200,000,000 revolving credit facility available to the Company and a term loan facility of $110,000,000. The credit facilities carry an interest rate based on U.S. dollar LIBOR plus a margin
	of between 1.20% and 2.45% which is dependent on the Company&#146;s ratio of net debt to EBITDA. Net debt and EBITDA are
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-GAAP
</FONT>
	measures of liquidity defined in the credit facility. At December&nbsp;31,
	2016, $161.0&nbsp;million was drawn under the revolving credit facility and the term loan facility of $110.0&nbsp;million was drawn. The term loan has an $11,000,000 repayment installment due December&nbsp;28, 2017, a $16,500,000 installment due
	December&nbsp;28, 2018 and a $22,000,000 installment due December&nbsp;28, 2019, with the outstanding balance due on November&nbsp;6, 2020.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The Company has taken out interest rate swaps to hedge interest rate risk on core debt. As at 31&nbsp;December 2016, interest rate swaps with a notional
	value of $160,000,000 were in place. Fixed interest rates payable under the interest rate swaps vary from 1.41% to 1.67%. Interest rate swaps in place to hedge interest rate risk on the term loan have an amortizing profile matching the amortization
	of the term loan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	46
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage48"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D303010D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The Company has $273.3&nbsp;million long-term debt and finance leases (including the current portion) which
	is partly offset by $101.9&nbsp;million cash and cash equivalents. The interest payable on long-term debt (excluding the margin) exceeds the interest receivable on positive cash balances. On a gross basis, assuming no additional interest on the cash
	balances, a hypothetical absolute change of 1% in U.S. base interest rates for a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-year
</FONT>
	period would impact net income and cash flows by approximately $2.2&nbsp;million before tax. On a net basis, assuming
	additional interest on the cash balances and short-term investments, a hypothetical absolute change of 1% in U.S. base interest rates for a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-year
</FONT>
	period would impact net income and cash flows by
	approximately $1.2&nbsp;million before tax.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The above does not
	consider the effect of interest or exchange rate changes on overall activity nor management action to mitigate such changes. As at December&nbsp;31, 2016, Innospec has interest rate swaps which mitigate a proportion of the risk identified above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Exchange Rate Risk
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The Company generates an element of its revenues and incurs some operating
	costs in currencies other than the U.S. dollar. The reporting currency of the Company is the U.S.&nbsp;dollar.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The Company evaluates the functional currency of each reporting unit according to the economic environment in which it operates. Several major subsidiaries of the Company operating outside of the U.S.
	have the U.S. dollar as their functional currency due to the nature of the markets in which they operate. In addition, the financial position and results of operations of some of our overseas subsidiaries are reported in the relevant local currency
	and then translated to U.S. dollars at the applicable currency exchange rate for inclusion in our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The primary foreign currencies in which we have exchange rate fluctuation exposure are the European Union euro, British pound sterling and Brazilian Real.
	Changes in exchange rates between these foreign currencies and the U.S. dollar will affect the recorded levels of our assets and liabilities, to the extent that such figures reflect the inclusion of foreign assets and liabilities which are
	translated into U.S. dollars for presentation in our consolidated financial statements, as well as our results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The Company&#146;s objective in managing the exposure to foreign currency fluctuations is to reduce earnings and cash flow volatility associated with
	foreign currency exchange rate changes. Accordingly, the Company enters into various contracts that change in value as foreign currency exchange rates change to protect the U.S.&nbsp;dollar value of its existing foreign currency denominated assets,
	liabilities, commitments, and cash flows. The Company also uses foreign currency forward exchange contracts to offset a portion of the Company&#146;s exposure to certain foreign currency denominated revenues so that gains and losses on these
	contracts offset changes in the U.S.&nbsp;dollar value of the related foreign currency denominated revenues. The objective of the hedging program is to reduce earnings and cash flow volatility related to changes in foreign currency exchange rates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	47
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage49"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D303010D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	The trading of our Fuel Specialties, Performance Chemicals and Oilfield Services segments is inherently
	naturally hedged and accordingly changes in exchange rates would not be material to our earnings or financial position. The cost base of our Octane Additives reporting segment and corporate costs, however, are largely denominated in British pound
	sterling. A 5% strengthening in the U.S. dollar against British pound sterling would increase reported operating income by approximately $2.5&nbsp;million for a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-year
</FONT>
	period excluding the impact of any
	foreign currency forward exchange contracts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Where a 5%
	strengthening of the U.S. dollar has been used as an illustration, a 5% weakening would be expected to have the opposite effect on operating income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Raw Material Cost Risk
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	We use a variety of raw materials, chemicals and energy in our manufacturing and blending processes. Many of the raw materials that we use are derived
	from petrochemical-based feedstocks which can be subject to periods of rapid and significant cost instability. These fluctuations in cost can be caused by political instability in oil producing nations and elsewhere, or other factors influencing
	global supply and demand of these materials, over which we have no or little control. We use long-term contracts (generally with fixed or formula-based costs) and advance bulk purchases to help ensure availability and continuity of supply, and to
	manage the risk of cost increases. From time to time we enter into hedging arrangements for certain raw materials, but do not typically enter into hedging arrangements for all raw materials, chemicals or energy costs. Should the costs of raw
	materials, chemicals or energy increase, and should we not be able to pass on these cost increases to our customers, then operating margins and cash flows from operating activities would be adversely impacted. Should raw material costs increase
	significantly, then the Company&#146;s need for working capital could similarly increase. Any of these risks could adversely impact our results of operations, financial position and cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	48
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage50"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D303010D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
</EFX_MARKET_RISK>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="4">
<B>
<A NAME="D303010D10K_HTM_TX303010_13">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;8
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">

	Financial Statements and Supplementary Data
</B>
</FONT>

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	The Board of Directors and Stockholders of Innospec Inc.:
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of Innospec Inc.
	(Innospec) and subsidiaries as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, and the related consolidated statements of income, comprehensive income, accumulated other comprehensive loss, cash flows and equity for each of the years in the three-year period
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. We also have audited Innospec&#146;s internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2016, based on criteria established in
<I>
	Internal Control &#150; Integrated Framework
</I>
	(2013)&nbsp;issued by the
	Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO). Innospec&#146;s management is responsible for these consolidated financial statements, for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting, and for its
	assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting, included in the accompanying &#147;Management&#146;s Report on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting&#148;. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these
	consolidated financial statements and an opinion on Innospec&#146;s internal control over financial reporting based on our audits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we
	plan and perform the audits to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement and whether effective internal control over financial reporting was maintained in all material respects. Our audits
	of the consolidated financial statements included examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements, assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, and
	evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. Our audit of internal control over financial reporting included obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting, assessing the risk that a material weakness exists, and
	testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk. Our audits also included performing such other procedures as we considered necessary in the circumstances. We believe that our audits
	provide a reasonable basis for our opinions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	A company&#146;s
	internal control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted
	accounting principles. A company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures that (1)&nbsp;pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions
	and dispositions of the assets of the company; (2)&nbsp;provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that
	receipts and expenditures of the company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the company; and (3)&nbsp;provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized
	acquisition, use, or disposition of the company&#146;s assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	49
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage51"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D303010D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect
	misstatements. Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may
	deteriorate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	In our opinion, the consolidated financial
	statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of Innospec and subsidiaries as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, and the results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the years in the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	three-year
</FONT>
	period ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, in conformity with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles. Also in our opinion, Innospec maintained, in all material respects, effective internal control over
	financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2016, based on criteria established in
<I>
	Internal Control &#150; Integrated
</I>
<I>
	Framework
</I>
	(2013)&nbsp;issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Innospec acquired the European Differentiated Surfactants business
	(&#147;Huntsman&#148;) during 2016 from Huntsman Investments (Netherlands) B.V. and management excluded from its assessment of the effectiveness of Innospec&#146;s internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2016,
	Huntsman&#146;s internal control over financial reporting associated with total assets of $228.2&nbsp;million (of which $107.4&nbsp;million represents goodwill and other intangibles included within the scope of the assessment) and total revenues of
	$0.0&nbsp;million included in the consolidated financial statements of Innospec and subsidiaries as of and for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. Our audit of internal control over financial reporting of Innospec also excluded an evaluation of
	the internal control over financial reporting of Huntsman.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	/s/
	KPMG Audit Plc
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
	Manchester, United Kingdom
</FONT>
</P>

	Amortization of deferred finance costs of
	$0.4&nbsp;million (2015 &#150; $1.2&nbsp;million, 2014 &#150; $0.7 million) for the year are included in depreciation and amortization in the cash flow statement but in interest expense in the income statement. Cash payments/receipts in respect of
	income taxes and interest are disclosed in Note 10 and Note 11, respectively, of the Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements.
